instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message:
Hi. I have this A1425 with a missing PP5V_S5. I replaced U7000 and U7201 same thing. There was a moment before i did anything that it showed green light once and powered on and then it stopped. The SMC I also re-balled.

PPBUS_G3H -12.3v
PPDCIN_G3H - 15.2v
PP3V42_G3H - 3.4v
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.4v

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message: I have replaced the SMC with another one from a different model, now I have a green light but no power and on/off triggers

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS now?
PPBUS_G3H voltage is correct?

Be sure to use original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message: 3V3_S5/SUS it's 0v and  PPBUS_G3H  is 12.6v. I am using the original 85w adapter

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message: I ordered another SMC with exactly the same and soldered it but still same outcome green light no power PPBUS_G3H is 12.29v now

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message:
May be bad SMC, or not good soldered.
Put back original SMC.
Try to get correct PPBUS_G3H again.

Check if SMC_PM_G2_EN comes on.

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message: I had a shorted line on P3V3S5_LL and replaced U7201 power on now all good :)the battery is not good and it's really slow...

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message: I tried 2 different Bios files Clear ME and another but when i try to boot the installation it shows 5101f error... any idea ?

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message:
Machine being slow can be caused by bad battery.
You should test with known good battery.

Did you run corresponding ASD test?

threads.title: Macbook A1425
threads.message:
We can close this case the new smc somehow burned i soldered back the old SMC and still the same. I advised client that also the battery is  bad, and he didn't want to proceed, just data taken out. 

Thanks :)
